translation: In the Chapter on the Causes and Conditions of Mahākāśyapa

source_sentence: 爾時，跋陀羅身正著睡眠，其夫起立經行之時，彼地方所有一黑蛇欲得行過。
translation: At the time, Bhadra's body was drowsy, and when his husband got up and stood up to walk, there was a black snake in that place who wanted to get around.

source_sentence: 時跋陀羅既著睡眠，而其一手懸垂床梐，畢鉢羅耶見於黑蛇欲從彼過，
translation: When Bhadra fell asleep, his one hand was hanging from the bedside. Pippalāyāna saw that black snake was about to pass by him.

source_sentence: 跋陀羅手既垂下懸，心作是念，畏彼黑蛇蜇螫其手，即衣裹手，擎跋陀羅臂安床上。
translation: When Bhadra's hand was hanging down, he had this thought in his mind, afraid that black snake would sting him with its hand, wrapped his hand in his robe and lifted up Bhadra's arm to place it on the bed.

source_sentence: 爾時，跋陀羅以觸臂故，睡眠即覺，心生恐怖，愁憂不樂，意中疑怪，
translation: At that time, having touched his arm, Bhadra fell asleep and immediately woke up in sleep. His mind became frightened, distressed, uneasy, and doubtful.

source_sentence: 即便諮白畢鉢羅耶，作如是言：「賢善聖子！
translation: He then asked Pippalāya, saying, Good and good, noble son!

source_sentence: 仁於前時，可不與我有是要誓，我意不憙行於五慾，願修梵行。
translation: Good man, at the time before me, you weren't going to give me a vow that I wouldn't covet the five desires and want to cultivate religious practice.

source_sentence: 今為何故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 發如是心？」
translation: give rise to such a mind?

source_sentence: 畢鉢羅耶報言：「如是！
translation: Pippalaya replied, So it is!

source_sentence: 我不行慾。」
translation: I won't indulge in desire.

source_sentence: 跋陀羅言：「聖子！
translation: Bhadra said, Holy child!

source_sentence: 今若不行於慾，何故向者忽觸我臂。」
translation: Now, if you don't practice desire, why would someone suddenly touch my arm?

source_sentence: 爾時，畢鉢羅耶依實報言：「向有黑蛇從此而過，我見汝臂懸在床前，
translation: At that time, Pippalāya replied in truth: There was once a black serpent coming from here. I saw you with your arm suspended in front of the bed.

source_sentence: 我於彼時作如是念，恐畏彼蛇吐毒螫汝。
translation: At the time, I had this thought, 'I'm afraid that snake will spit out and sting you with poison.'

source_sentence: 我於彼時以衣裹手擎持汝臂，安置床上，實不故觸。」
translation: At the time, I wrapped my hand in my robe, lifted your arm, placed you on a bed, and didn't touch it for no reason.

source_sentence: 如是次第，彼之二人一處居止經十二年，同在室內各不相觸。
translation: In this order, the two of them lived in one place for twelve years and each stayed inside the room without touching the other.

source_sentence: 過十二年，後有一時，畢鉢羅耶父母命終，家業既廣，即便經營，畢鉢羅耶身自撿挍家外田作，
translation: After twelve years had passed, there was a time when Pippalāya’s parents died. As his family business expanded, he went on to operate it. At that time Pippalāya took up the land outside of his house and cultivated it himself.

source_sentence: 其跋陀羅修緝家內所有一切資生之業。
translation: That Bhadra cultivates all the activities that are necessary for living in his home.

source_sentence: 爾時，畢鉢羅耶曾於一時，語跋陀羅作如是言：「賢善仁者！
translation: At the time, there was a time when Pippalaya once spoke to Bhadra and said, Good man!

source_sentence: 汝處分教壓烏麻油，今欲將與諸牛等飲。」
translation: You've been partially instructed to press the oil of black sesame, and now you want to give it to the cattle to drink.

source_sentence: 其跋陀羅即報夫主：「如聖子教，我不敢違。」
translation: The Bhadra then reported to the husband, As the noble son taught, I wouldn't dare disobey him.

source_sentence: 聞是教已，喚諸使女而告之言：「汝等速疾壓烏麻油，聖子欲將飲於諸牛。」
translation: After hearing this teaching, he summoned the messengers and told them, You must quickly press black sesame oil; the noble son wants to drink it from the cow.

source_sentence: 爾時，使女聞跋陀羅如是言已，即將烏麻，置日中曬，而見諸虫，百千蠕動。
translation: At the time, the maid heard Bhadra's words like this, she took the black sesame and put it in the sun to dry, and saw hundreds of thousands of worms wriggling.

source_sentence: 見已各各共相謂言：「我等當得無量諸罪。」
translation: After they saw each other, they said to each other, We'll attain measureless sins.

source_sentence: 或復有言：「我等今者知有何罪？
translation: Again, some people may say, What sin do we now know?

source_sentence: 此之罪過屬跋陀羅，其使我等作如是事。」
translation: This offense belongs to Bhadra, who caused us to do such a thing.

source_sentence: 跋陀羅聞諸使女等作是言已，即語之言：「若有如是眾罪過者，汝等當更莫壓於油。」
translation: After he heard these words from the messengers, Bhadra said to them, If you commit such crimes, you mustn't press oil again.

source_sentence: 爾時，跋陀羅遣人摒擋彼烏麻已，入於室內，閉門思惟，心中不樂，低頭默然寂靜而坐。
translation: At the time, Bhadra sent someone to remove that crow's hemp, entered the room, closed the door, and contemplated, didn't delight in himself, bowed his head, remained silent, and sat quietly.

source_sentence: 其畢鉢羅，撿挍田地，觀看迴還，見諸眾生受彼種種無量苦惱，復覩諸牛受於困厄，
translation: The pippala examined the fertile fields and looked around, seeing that all sentient beings suffered from those various kinds of immeasurable suffering and distress. Furthermore, he saw that the cowherding cattle were in distress.

source_sentence: 作使駈逐暫不得停，見已憂惱，低頭默然，作是思惟：「嗚呼一切諸眾生輩！
translation: When he was compelled to hunt and chase, he couldn't stop for a while. Seeing it, he became sad and silent, bowed his head in shame, and thought, Whoops, all the sentient beings!

source_sentence: 受是苦惱。」
translation: To experience is painful and distressing.

source_sentence: 還至其家，心大憂愁，顏色不樂，低頭念坐。
translation: When he returned home, his mind became greatly distressed and his appearance was unpleasant. He sat cross-legged with his head lowered in thought.

source_sentence: 其跋陀羅見畢鉢羅如是憂惱低頭思惟，見已到邊，到已白言：「聖子！
translation: When Bhadra saw Pippala thus grieved, bowed his head in contemplation, went to the side of the road after seeing it, and said, Holy child!

source_sentence: 何故如是憂愁？
translation: Why is it so grieved?

source_sentence: 心內不樂，低頭而坐。
translation: With an unhappy mind, he bowed his head and sat down.

source_sentence: 仁今可不作如是念，我處分汝跋陀羅令使人壓油，不為我壓，以此因緣，
心不樂也？」
translation: The mind isn't happy?

source_sentence: 彼即報言：「賢善仁者！
translation: He then replied, Good man!

source_sentence: 我今不以如此因緣，心中不樂，低頭而住。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, I won't be happy in my heart now, nor will I stand with my head down.

source_sentence: 我於今朝，從此而去，撿挍田作，見諸眾生，受種種苦，來去行住，不得暫安。
translation: On this morning, I will leave here to clear the fields and cultivate them. Seeing that sentient beings are suffering from various kinds of pain, coming, going, standing, and traveling, I am unable to find peace for a moment.

source_sentence: 復見諸牛，種種作事，不曾停息，我見是已，作如是念：『嗚呼嗚呼！
translation: Again, when I saw the cows doing various things without ever stopping, I saw them and had this thought:

source_sentence: 諸眾生等，乃受是苦。』
translation: All sentient beings and so forth will experience this kind of suffering.'

source_sentence: 我以是故，心中不樂，低頭而住。」
translation: Because of this, I'm unhappy in mind and stand with my head down.

source_sentence: 時，跋陀羅復報夫言：「善仁聖子！
translation: Bhadra then again reported to the husband, saying, Good and noble son!

source_sentence: 我今亦見如是大患。」
translation: Now, I've also seen such a great danger.

source_sentence: 其夫問言：「賢善仁者！
translation: The husband asked, Good man!

source_sentence: 汝見何患？」
translation: What's the trouble you see?

source_sentence: 其跋陀羅次第即說如是因緣。
translation: The Bhadra then explains these causes and conditions in order.

source_sentence: 爾時，畢鉢羅耶語跋陀羅女作如是言：「賢善仁者！
translation: It was then that Pippalāya said to the woman Bhadra, Good man!

source_sentence: 住在家內，難行清淨，無缺無犯，無損無害，終不能盡，一形一命，可得稱心，
translation: They live in their houses, but it is difficult to keep them pure and genuine. There are no faults or transgressions, no injury or harm; they cannot be destroyed at all. Their minds can be measured by the number of forms and the number of living beings.

source_sentence: 修行梵行。」
translation: He cultivates the religious practice.

source_sentence: 其跋陀羅報言：「聖子！
translation: Bhadra replied, Holy child!

source_sentence: 是故我等二人，詳共捨家出家。」
translation: That's why we two renounced the householder's life together and left home.

source_sentence: 是時畢鉢羅耶，即便報彼跋陀羅言：「賢善仁者！
translation: Pippalaya then even reported to Bhadra, saying, Good man!

source_sentence: 汝今且住，我當求師，若尋得已，當告汝知，汝於後時，捨家出家。」
translation: Now, you must stay here; I will seek my teacher. If I find him, I will tell you to know that you'll leave home and leave home at a later time.

source_sentence: 爾時，畢鉢羅耶即喚家內所有作使諸男女等，而告之言：「汝輩可有當我錢財，
translation: At that time, Pippalāyī summoned the men and women who were his servants at home and said to them, “You may give me money and property.

source_sentence: 或復穀米，皆屬汝等，皆放為良，我欲出家修行梵行，為厭離故。」
translation: Or grains and rice, which all belong to you, are released as good because I want to leave home and cultivate the religious practice in order to become disillusioned with it.

source_sentence: 爾時，畢鉢羅耶取己白[疊*毛]無價之衣，即時用作彼僧伽梨，即請一人，
translation: At that time, Pippalāyāna took his priceless white cotton cloth and asked one of the monks to make a monk’s robe out of it.

source_sentence: 剃其鬚髮，而作是言：「世間可有大阿羅漢而出家者，我今隨其出家修道。」
translation: He shaved his hair and said, There may be a great arhat in the world who leaves home, but now I'll follow him to leave home and cultivate it.

source_sentence: 當於彼時，世間未有一阿羅漢，唯除如來、多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。
translation: At the time, there wasn't a single arhat in the world except for the Tathāgata, Tathāgata, Arhat, or Samyak-saṃbuddha.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊於晨朝時，明相現已，證阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān had manifested his luminous appearance in the morning and realized unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 爾時，畢鉢羅耶迦葉，當於是日，夜分已過，日始初出，尋亦出家。
translation: It was then that Pippalāya-kāśyapa renounced the householder’s life for the first time on that day, after the night had passed.

source_sentence: 是畢鉢羅耶迦葉，生於大迦葉種姓之內故，於世間得迦葉名。
translation: Because this pippalāya-kāśyapa was born within the great Kāśyapa's family, he gets the name Kāśyapa in the world.

source_sentence: 彼出家已，於聚落內，次第乞食，漸次而行。
translation: Having renounced the householder’s life, he entered a village to solicit almsfood one by one and proceeded one step by step.

source_sentence: 復一時間，次第遊行到摩伽陀國，摩伽陀聚落，至那荼陀村王舍大城，
translation: Again, at one time the Master proceeded in order to the country of Magadha. From the village of Magadha up to the great city of Rājagṛha in the village of Nālandā.

source_sentence: 其間忽見如來在彼一神祇處，爾時是神名曰多子，在於彼坐，甚大端正，
translation: Suddenly he saw the Tathāgata sitting there in a magical apparition, named Sadāparibhūta. He was seated there and very large and handsome.

source_sentence: 其身正直，猶如虛空之內眾宿莊嚴。
translation: His body was upright and straightforward, like the adornments of the constellations in space.

source_sentence: 迦葉見已，即得清淨，得無二想：「我於今者，必見教師；
translation: Having seen this, Kāśyapa attained purity and acquired the thought of nonduality.

source_sentence: 我於今者，必見婆伽婆；
translation: I will surely see Bhagavān in the future.

source_sentence: 我於今者，必見一切智；
translation: At the present time I am bound to see omniscience.

source_sentence: 我於今者，必見世尊一切見者，我見世尊；
translation: World-honored One, I now certainly see the World-honored One. All those who see - I see the World-honored One.

source_sentence: 我見無礙知見者，我見世尊。」
translation: Those who see self without obstructive knowing and seeing, I see the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 彼大迦葉，如是得淨心已，心心相續，正念不散，頂禮世尊足下已畢，
translation: Having thus attained a pure mind, Mahākāśyapa, his mind was continuous and his thoughts were not distracted. After bowing down at the feet of the World-honored One, he thought:

source_sentence: 右膝著地，在於佛前，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: He knelt with his right knee on the ground in front of the Buddha and said to him, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我是世尊聲聞弟子，唯願世尊，與我為師，我是世尊聲聞弟子也。」
translation: I am the disciple of the śrāvaka disciples of the Bhagavān, so may the Bhagavān give me as his teacher, and I am the disciple of the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 「彼見佛在多子樹，　　猶如金像光顯赫，
translation: “They see the Buddha in many seed trees, Like a golden image shining brilliantly.

source_sentence: 其心內發一切智，　　合掌歡喜向世尊。
translation: Within his mind, he arouses omniscience and joins his palms in joy toward the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 於彼林處禮佛足，　　合掌尊前作是言：
translation: In that forest, he bowed at the Buddha’s feet, joined his palms and said:

source_sentence: 『唯願世尊為我師，　　猶如闇處燃燈照。』」
translation: 'Please let the Bhagavān be my teacher, just like a lamp burning in a dark place.'

source_sentence: 是故論者而說偈言：爾時，世尊告迦葉言：「迦葉！
translation: That's why the treatiseist spoke a verse, saying, At that point, the Bhagavān addressed Kāśyapa, saying, Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 若有聲聞弟子，如是一心正念已訖，言是我師。
translation: Suppose there's a śrāvaka disciple who thus completes this single mental correct thought with one mind and says, 'This is my teacher.'

source_sentence: 如是之心，尊重供養；
translation: With minds like this, they honor and offer support.

source_sentence: 而彼教師，不知言知，不見言見。
translation: The teacher, however, didn't know what he said and didn't see what he said.

source_sentence: 彼人以此虛妄語故，受是尊重供養之者，彼人頭破作於七分。
translation: Because of these false words, that person's head breaks into seven parts when they receive this honorable offering.

source_sentence: 然大迦葉！
translation: Still, Mahākāśyapa!

source_sentence: 我今知實言知，見實言見，我為聲聞諸弟子等說法之時，說於因緣，非無因緣，
translation: When I teach the Dharma to śrāvaka disciples and others, I explain it in terms of causes and conditions, not in terms of non-causes.

source_sentence: 非無開遮，非但開遮亦現神通，非唯現通，亦有開遮，非無開遮。
translation: It's not without opening or shutting, and it's not just opening or shutting that also manifests supernormal abilities, not only does it reveal abilities, but there's also opening and shutting, not without opening and shutting.

source_sentence: 「復次迦葉！
translation: Furthermore, Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 我於彼時，說於因緣，乃至亦有開遮，非無開遮。
translation: At the time, I'm speaking of causes and conditions, up to there are also openings and shuts, not no openings and shuts.

source_sentence: 如我所說，應奉行之，勿得違也。
translation: As I say, you should adhere to it; don't disobey it.

source_sentence: 隨順我言，若如是者，於當來世，長夜獲得自利益事，得大安樂也。
translation: If someone follows my words, then in the future life they'll attain self-benefiting things for a long time and attain great peace and happiness.

source_sentence: 「復次，迦葉！
translation: Furthermore, Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝應如是學。
translation: You should thus train.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝若欲學如是行者，於梵行人內下中上所，應起敬重慚愧之心。
translation: If you want to train in such practices, you should give rise to respect and a sense of shame among the religious practitioners, who are inferior, middling, and superior.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝應如是學也。
translation: You should thus train.

source_sentence: 「復次，迦葉！
translation: Furthermore, Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝於彼時，常起正念，勿暫捨離。
translation: At the time, you should always have right mindfulness and not let go of it for a moment.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝於此事，復應當學。
translation: You should also train in this matter.

source_sentence: 「復次，迦葉！
translation: Furthermore, Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝於彼時，於五陰中，應觀生滅之相。
translation: At the time, you should observe the characteristics of arising and ceasing in the five aggregates.

source_sentence: 所謂此是色，此是色生，此是色滅，此是受，此是想，此是行，此是識，
translation: This is form, this is the arising of form, this is the disappearance of form, this is sensation, this is perception, this is volition, and this is consciousness.

source_sentence: 此是識生，此是識滅。
translation: This is the arising of consciousness, and this is the cessation of consciousness.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝於是處，應如是學。」
translation: In this place, you should thus train.

source_sentence: 於時，長老摩訶迦葉既蒙世尊作是教已，生是不淨，常乞食食，經於七日，
translation: At that time the venerable Mahākāśyapa, having been instructed in this way by the World-honored One, was born impure. For seven days he always begged for food and drink.

source_sentence: 至於八日，如教生智。
translation: On the eighth day, wisdom arises as he teaches.

source_sentence: 於時世尊如是教已，從座而起，於是長老摩訶迦葉，侍送世尊。
translation: After the Bhagavān had thus instructed them, the Bhagavān rose from his seat, and then the elder Mahākāśyapa escorted the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊行路未久，便在路側，到一樹下，到彼樹已，然其長老摩訶迦葉，
translation: At that time, not long after the World-honored One had set out on his journey, he stopped at the side of the road and went to a tree. Having gone there, however, the elder Mahākāśyapa said:

source_sentence: 取己身上僧伽梨衣，四疊敷地，而白佛言：「世尊！
translation: He took the saṃghāṭi robes on his body, spread them over four layers on the ground, and said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是座為世尊設，憐愍我故，佛坐是座。」
translation: This seat was set up for the Bhagavān, and because he had pity for me, the Buddha sat on this seat.

source_sentence: 作是語已，於時世尊便坐彼座，坐已佛告長老摩訶迦葉言：「迦葉！
translation: After he said this, the Bhagavān then sat down on that seat, and after he sat down, the Buddha addressed the elder Mahākāśyapa, saying, Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 如此僧伽梨，極為微妙，最勝最軟。」
translation: Such an saṃghāṭi is extremely subtle, the most excellent and the softest.

source_sentence: 時長老迦葉，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The elder Kāśyapa then said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 善哉善哉！
translation: Excellent, excellent!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今者憐愍我故，受我是座。」
translation: Now, out of pity for me, he's accepting my seat.

source_sentence: 於時，世尊告彼長老摩訶迦葉，作如是言：「迦葉！
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed the elder Mahākāśyapa and said, Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝能持我所著糞掃衣不？」
translation: Can you carry the garbage and sweeping clothes that I wear?

source_sentence: 於時，長老摩訶迦葉白佛言：「唯然世尊！
translation: The elder Mahākāśyapa then said to the Buddha, Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我能持彼如來所著糞掃衣耳。」
translation: I can carry the garbage and sweeping clothes that the Tathāgata wears.

source_sentence: 於時，世尊即授長老摩訶迦葉麤糞掃衣，世尊便受摩訶迦葉所著妙服。
translation: The Bhagavān then gave the elder Mahākāśyapa a garment made of rags and sweeping clothes, and the Bhagavān accepted the marvelous robe worn by Mahākāśyapa.

source_sentence: 「爾時，波羅[木*奈]城中有一人，其家貧苦而少居積。
translation: At the time, there was a man in the city of Vārāṇasī whose family was poor and suffering but lived sparingly.

source_sentence: 而彼貧人，見辟支佛多伽羅尸棄，漸進而前，威儀庠序，視地而行，進止得所，
translation: The poor man, seeing that the pratyekabuddha Tathāgata had abandoned Śikhin, gradually stepped forward. With dignified manner he looked at the ground and walked up and down to find his place.

source_sentence: 舒顏平視，威儀具足，心得正念。
translation: He had a peaceful countenance and was endowed with deportment. His mind was correctly concentrated.

source_sentence: 於時貧人，見辟支佛，心得清淨，漸到彼已，白辟支佛，作如是言：『善哉大仙！
translation: When the poor man saw the pratyekabuddha, his mind became pure and he gradually arrived there, said to the pratyekabuddha, 'Good, great sage!

source_sentence: 於此城中，求乞飲食，可得以不？』
translation: Can I ask for food and drink in this city to eat or drink?'

source_sentence: 尊者報言：『善哉仁者！
translation: The venerable replied, 'Good, my lord!'

source_sentence: 我於此城，乞食不得。』
translation: In this city, I won't be allowed to beg for food.'

source_sentence: 「時彼貧人，白辟支佛言：『善哉大仙！
translation: That poor man then said to the pratyekabuddha, 'Good, great sage!

source_sentence: 來詣我家。』
translation: Come to my house.'

source_sentence: 於時彼人家內，唯有稗飯一升成熟已訖，遂將辟支來入家中，敷設安坐，
translation: At that time, there was only one sheng of cooked rice in the house. Having matured it, they brought the pratyekabuddhas into the house and spread out their beds to sit comfortably.

source_sentence: 以飯奉獻。
translation: He offered the rice as an offering.

source_sentence: 而諸辟支佛，有如是法，以神通力，教化眾生，不以餘通。
translation: But the pratyekabuddhas have a teaching like this, which they teach and transform sentient beings by means of their supernormal powers, not by other supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 爾時，多伽羅辟支佛，於彼人所，受得食已，憐愍彼故，從彼貧舍，騰空而去。
translation: At the time, the Tathāgata pratyekabuddha, who had received food from that person's place and had pity for him, rose up from his poor abode in the sky and departed.

source_sentence: 時彼貧人，見彼尊者辟支佛騰空而去，彼既見已，歡喜踊躍，身心遍滿，
translation: The poor man then saw the venerable pratyekabuddha rise up into the sky and leave. Having seen him, he was delighted and jumped for joy, his body and mind all overflowing.

source_sentence: 頂戴十指合掌恭敬，頭面作禮，乞如是願：『願於將來，值遇如是辟支聖人，
translation: He put his palms together with ten fingers in respect, saluted him by bowing his forehead and face, and made the following vow: May I meet such a pratyekabuddha in the future!

source_sentence: 或復勝者；
translation: Or they may be superior.

source_sentence: 若彼聖人，所說法要，願得聞持速疾解悟；
translation: If that noble person teaches the essentials of the Dharma, may they be able to hear and retain it.

source_sentence: 又願生生世世，不墮惡道之中。』
translation: May I also be born in the world and not fall into a bad path?'

source_sentence: 「汝等比丘！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 欲知爾時波羅[木*奈]城貧苦之人，請多伽羅辟支世尊到其家內而施食者，
translation: “World-honored One, you should know that at that time the poor and oppressed people of Benares invited the World-honored One, the Tathāgata pratyekabuddha, to their house and offered food to them.

source_sentence: 摩訶迦葉比丘是也。
translation: This is the monk Mahākāśyapa.

source_sentence: 時彼貧人，以少貯積，能以好心，施多伽羅辟支世尊一食緣故，千返生於北欝單越處，
translation: That poor man then, because he stored up a little and gave it to the Bhagavān Takara pratyekabuddha with good intentions for the sake of one meal, was born a thousand times in Uttarakuru in the north.

source_sentence: 於無量世，往返恒生剎利大姓婆羅門種居士大家。
translation: In an immeasurable number of worlds, he traveled back and forth to the great family of the kṣatriyas and brāhmaṇas in the Ganges.

source_sentence: 藉是業報因緣力故，於迦葉佛出世之時，得為迦尸國王訖利尸子。
translation: Because of the power of these karmic retributions as causes and conditions, when Kāśyapa Buddha emerged in the world, he became the king of Kāśi and the kṣatriya Kṛṣiputra.

source_sentence: 其迦尸國王訖利尸子，恭敬尊重迦葉如來、阿羅訶、三藐三佛陀，盡於一世，
translation: The king of Kāśi, Kāriputra, respected and honored the Tathāgata Kassapa, the Ārāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha for as long as one world.

source_sentence: 然後涅槃。
translation: Then he'll attain nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 是迦尸國王，為佛舍利造七寶塔，其七寶者，所謂金、銀、頗梨、琉璃、虎珀、瑪瑙及車璩等，
translation: The king of Kaśinagara built a seven-jeweled stupa for the Buddha’s relics. These were so-called made of gold, silver, crystal, beryl, lapis lazuli, amber, agate, and chariot jewels.

source_sentence: 其寶塔內七寶莊挍，外以石砌覆其寶塔，其塔高妙，極一由旬，廣半由旬。
translation: Inside the jeweled stupa was adorned with seven kinds of treasure, and on the outside it was covered with stone. The stupa was as high as one yojana in height and half a yojana in width.

source_sentence: 其王子名奢婆陵伽(隋言攀緣)，於其塔上，造七寶蓋，遍覆其塔。
translation: The prince, named Śavastiṅga (known as Cūḍapanthaka in Sui), built a seven-jeweled canopy over the stūpa and covered it all over.

source_sentence: 「（又有師說：『造塔八分，於比丘僧，布施衣服飲食靴履，施已作願：「願我將來值如是聖，
translation: Again, another teacher said,'build eight parts of a stūpa and give it to the monks and nuns for clothing, food, drink, shoes, and footwear. After giving it, make the following vow:

source_sentence: 彼聖說法，尋即領悟。
translation: When that sage teaches the Dharma, he immediately apprehends it.

source_sentence: 又願不生惡道之中，所生之處，得金色身。」
translation: Also, may you not be born in a bad path and attain a golden body wherever you're born.

source_sentence: 作是事已，遂從父王，求乞出家，其父不許。
translation: After he did so, he asked his father to leave home and begged him to do so, but his father wouldn't allow him.

source_sentence: 時彼王子，父命終後，乃得出家。
translation: The prince then left home after his father's death.

source_sentence: 既出家已，讀誦經典，成就禪定，於彼命終，往返恒生天人之內，無量世中，
translation: Having renounced the householder’s life, he recited scriptures and perfected meditation. At the end of his life there, he was reborn in the realm of heavenly beings or among human beings as an eternally abiding sentient being for countless ages.

source_sentence: 遊歷是已，於最後身，今得生於尼拘陀羯婆羅門家。
translation: Having done so, in his last body he was now reborn in the house of a brāhmaṇa named Nirgranthaka.

source_sentence: 其家巨富，具足財寶，乃至所須，皆無少乏。
translation: His family was very wealthy and endowed with all kinds of possessions, including everything they needed. They did not lack anything at all.

source_sentence: 而是摩訶迦葉，於迦葉佛舍利塔上，造七寶蓋，供養尊重因緣力故，得金色身，
translation: Instead, Mahākāśyapa built a seven-jeweled canopy on top of the stupa containing the relics of Kāśyapa Buddha’s relic bones to honor and venerate them. Because of this he attained a golden body due to the power of his causal conditions.

source_sentence: 以於彼時，乞如是願：「願我不生惡道。」
translation: At the time, he begged for this vow, May I not be born in a bad path.

source_sentence: 以是業報因緣力故，從是已來，不墮惡道，常得生於天人之處，受於無量無邊樂報。
translation: Because of the power of these karmic retributions as causes and conditions, they won't fall into bad destinies ever after that, always attain birth among gods and humans, and experience measureless and limitless rewards of happiness.

source_sentence: 而於彼時，復乞願言：「願我將來值是聖人，既得值已，勿令背我，或勝此聖，
translation: He then again begged, “May I meet this holy man in the future! Having met him, do not let him turn away from me.

source_sentence: 彼若說法，聞已即解。」
translation: If they teach the Dharma, they'll understand it after hearing it.

source_sentence: 以彼業報因緣力故，得值於我如是教化，即值我已，即得出家，具足眾戒，
translation: Because of the power of the karmic retribution as cause and condition, they'll be able to meet me in such a way to teach.

source_sentence: 證羅漢果。
translation: He'll realize the fruit of the arhat.

source_sentence: 我所授記，諸比丘中，少欲知足，即此上座摩訶迦葉比丘是也。』
translation: Among the monks I gave assurance to, this is the monk Mahākāśyapa, the highest seat among them, who has few desires and knows enough.'

source_sentence: ）「諸比丘！
translation: ) Monks!

source_sentence: 此是摩訶迦葉，往昔所造功德業報因緣力故，生於大富婆羅門家，乃至無所乏少，
translation: “This is how Mahākāśyapa was born in the house of a wealthy brāhmaṇa in the past, by the power of the karmic retribution of his past virtuous deeds.

source_sentence: 身相端正，最妙最勝，狀如金像，復得出家，具持眾戒，證阿羅漢果。
translation: Their bodies and features are correct, most beautiful and superior, shaped like a golden image, they again leave home, observe all the precepts, and realize the fruit of arhatship.

source_sentence: 故我授記：少欲知足，頭陀第一者，即摩訶迦葉比丘是也。」
translation: That's why I gave a prediction that the first ascetic who has few desires and is satisfied, namely, the monk Mahākāśyapa.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊經於多時，復一時間，告大迦葉作如是言：「迦葉！
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān again addressed Mahākāśyapa at another time for a long period of time and said, Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝今將邁，少年已過老年復至，汝身所著糞掃奢那麤弊之服，宜須捨棄，
translation: As you are about to leave home, your youth has passed away and you will return in old age. It is advisable for you to discard the filthy cloth that you wear on your body, as well as the coarse clothes made of rags and silkworm hide.

source_sentence: 今可取我上妙衣服。
translation: Now, you can take my most wonderful clothing.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝來，如是之服，長者所施，微細輕軟，刀所割成，縫治著身，受他人請，
translation: “Come, you people! Such is the robe that the wealthy man gave to me. It is fine and light; cut with a knife, sewn into pieces, worn on the body, and dressed like this at the request of others.

source_sentence: 常在佛邊，勿離於我。」
translation: Be always at the Buddha's side, and don't part with me.

source_sentence: 作是語已，時，大迦葉白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After he said this, Mahākāśyapa said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於長夜，在阿蘭若，亦常讚歎阿蘭若法。
translation: For a long time, I've been in Araṇya, and I've always praised the teachings of Araṇya.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，乞食活命，亦復讚歎乞食功德。
translation: For a long time, I've begged for food to keep me alive, and I've praised the merit of begging for food.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，著糞掃衣，亦復常歎糞掃衣德。
translation: For a long time, I've been wearing robes made of rags and sweeping clothes, and I've always praised the virtue of those robes.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，不非時食，亦復讚歎不非時法。
translation: During the long night, I don't eat at an ungodly hour, and I also praise what's not an ungodly hour.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，修一坐食，亦復讚歎一坐食法。
translation: For a long time, I've cultivated the food of one seat and also praised the food method of one seat.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，受一摶食節量飡噉，亦復讚歎受一摶食，及以讚歎節量食法。
translation: For a long time, I've accepted a nutritious diet that's based on moderation, and I've also praised accepting a nutritious diet, and I've praised the method of eating moderation.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，在於塜間，亦復讚歎在塚間法。
translation: For a long time, I've been in the cemetery, and I've also praised the method of staying in the cemetery.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，在於露地，亦復讚歎在露地法。
translation: For a long time, I've been in the open air for a long time, and I've also praised the method of being in the open air.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，住在樹下，亦復讚歎住樹下法。
translation: For a long time, I've been living under a tree for a long time, and I've praised the method of living under a tree.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，在於經行，亦復讚歎在經行法。
translation: For a long time, I've been walking up and down in the sūtras, and I've also praised the method of walking up and down in the sūtras.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，常坐不臥，亦復讚歎常不臥法。
translation: For a long time, I always sat and didn't lie down, and I also praised the method of always not lying down.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，唯畜三衣，亦復讚歎畜三衣法。
translation: For a long time I stored only the three kinds of cloth, and also praised the practice of storing the three kinds of cloth.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，少欲知足，亦復讚歎少欲知足。
translation: For a long time, I've had few desires and fulfilled them, and I've praised having few desires and fulfilled them.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，樂於寂靜，亦復讚歎樂寂靜法。
translation: For a long time, I enjoyed the state of quiescence and also praised the method of enjoying it.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，不曾樂說無益之語，亦復讚歎不樂無益言語之法。
translation: For a long time, I've never enjoyed speaking useless words, and I've also praised the teaching of using useless words that aren't enjoyable.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，常行精進，亦復讚歎常精進法。
translation: For a long time, I've always practiced exertion, and I've also praised the method of constant exertion.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，成就正念，亦復讚歎成正念法。
translation: For a long time, I've cultivated right mindfulness, and I've also praised the method of accomplishing right mindfulness.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，成就正定，亦復讚歎成正定法。
translation: For a long time, I've accomplished right concentration, and I've also praised the method of accomplishing right concentration.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，成就智慧，亦復讚歎成智慧法。
translation: For a long time, I've cultivated wisdom and praised the method of accomplishing wisdom.

source_sentence: 我於長夜，常入禪定，亦復讚歎入禪定法。」
translation: For a long time, I've always entered meditation and praised the method of entering meditation.

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉，作如是言：「迦葉！
translation: The Buddha addressed Kāśyapa and said, Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝見何利益故，長夜自行阿蘭若法，亦復讚歎行阿蘭若法，乃至長夜自入禪定，
translation: What benefit do you see from practicing the rules of foran over a long period of time, and also praising the practice of the rules of foran over a long period of time until you enter meditation yourself?

source_sentence: 亦復讚歎入禪定法？」
translation: Do you also praise the method of entering meditation?

source_sentence: 於是，大迦葉白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Then Mahākāśyapa said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我見二種利故，長夜在阿蘭若處，亦復讚歎行阿蘭若者，乃至長夜常入禪定，
translation: Because I see these two kinds of benefits, I'll stay in a forest dwelling place for a long time and praise those who practice forest dwelling, even as long as they enter meditation overnight.

source_sentence: 亦復讚歎常入定者。
translation: Again, he praises those who always enter concentration.

source_sentence: 何等為二？
translation: What are these two?

source_sentence: 一者我今現得安樂行法；
translation: The first is that I am now attaining the practice of peace and comfort.

source_sentence: 二者為後世眾生，生憐愍故。
translation: The second is to have compassion for the sentient beings of later ages.

source_sentence: 唯願將來人眾，見我等故，學我等行，應作是言：『過去之世，有老宿上座聲聞比丘，
translation: All we ask is that those who will come in the future to see us and study our practices should say these words: In a past life, there was an elderly bhikṣu, a śrāvaka monk.

source_sentence: 彼等長夜樂阿蘭若，讚歎阿蘭若行，乃至常入禪定，亦復讚歎常入禪定者。
translation: For a long time, they enjoyed the āraṇya and praised the practice of the āraṇya, up to the point where they always entered meditation, and they also praised those who always entered meditation.

source_sentence: 我等云何學於彼行，乃至自入禪定，讚歎常入禪定者。』
translation: How can we train in their practice or even enter meditation ourselves and praise those who always enter meditation?'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我見此二種利故，長夜在於阿蘭若行，亦復讚歎行阿蘭若者，乃至常入禪定，
translation: Because of these two kinds of benefits, I've been practicing in a forest dwelling for a long time, and I've also praised those who practice forest dwelling, even to the point where they always enter meditation.

source_sentence: 亦復讚歎常入禪定者。」
translation: Again, he praises those who always enter meditation.

source_sentence: 佛告大迦葉言：「善哉善哉！
translation: The Buddha told Mahākāśyapa, Good, good!

source_sentence: 大迦葉！
translation: Mahākāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝於來世，為多眾生，作大利益，作大安樂，安隱無量諸天人民。
translation: In the future you will bring great benefit and happiness to many sentient beings, bringing peace and comfort to measureless gods and people.

source_sentence: 是故汝今隨意所樂，住阿蘭若處，汝於隨時，欲見如來，時時來見。」
translation: That's why you now abide in the forest wherever you like, wanting to see the Tathāgata at any time and seeing him from time to time.

source_sentence: 於時，諸比丘問佛言曰：「希有世尊！
translation: The monks then asked the Buddha, Rarely, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是長老摩訶迦葉，何故乃能為多眾生，作大利益？」
translation: Why is it that the elder Mahākāśyapa can perform great benefits for many sentient beings?

source_sentence: 作是語已，佛告彼等諸比丘言：「諸比丘！
translation: After he said this, the Buddha addressed those monks, saying, Monks!

source_sentence: 是摩訶迦葉，非但現今為眾多人作大利益，過去之世，亦為多人，作大利益。」
translation: This is Mahākāśyapa, who doesn't just create great benefits for many people today; in a past life, he also created great benefits for many people.

source_sentence: 諸比丘白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The monks said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 唯然世尊！
translation: Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 願說因緣。」
translation: May I explain the causes and conditions?

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘言：「諸比丘！
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks, saying, Monks!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，此摩訶迦葉曾作帝釋天王。
translation: I'm mindful of the past, when this Mahākāśyapa once became Śakra Devānām-Indra.

source_sentence: 於彼時間，無佛出世，亦無辟支佛出世。
translation: At the time, there were no buddhas appearing in the world and no pratyekabuddhas appearing in the world.

source_sentence: 於彼時中，一切人輩，從人道中命終已後，捨人身已，多生惡道，少生人天。
translation: At that time, all the people were born among humans in the human realm. After their deaths ended, they abandoned their bodies and were mostly reborn in a bad realm of existence, but a small part of them were reborn among humans and gods.

source_sentence: 如是三十三天、夜摩天、兜率天、化樂天、他化自在天、梵身天墮已，
translation: Thus, the thirty-three gods, the Yama gods, the Trāyastriṃśa gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods, and the Brahmakāyika gods descended.

source_sentence: 多生惡道，少生人天。
translation: Most of them will be reborn in the evil realms of rebirth, but a small minority will be reborn among humans and gods.

source_sentence: 於彼之時，天處人處，多有空曠。
translation: At the time, there were many empty spaces in heaven and humans.

source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第四十六
translation: Fobenxing ji jing, vol. 46
